title.rendered: The 15 Best Online Yoga Websites in 2020

content.rendered:
Are you still at the very beginning of your yoga journey or are you an advanced yogi or yogini?

Are you looking to become a yoga teacher or have you been teaching yoga for years?

No matter where you currently stand on your yoga path, you deserve the best online yoga websites with content that is perfect for your unique yoga experience.

That is why this article presents you with TINT’s selection of the best online yoga websites in 2020.

What Are the Best Online Yoga Websites in 2020?

  • 1. Which Online Yoga Website Is Best for My Level of Yoga?
  • 1.1 Best Yoga Website for Beginners
  • 1.2 Best Yoga Website for Advanced Yogis
  • 1.3 Best Yoga Website for Teacher Trainings
  • 2. Which Online Yoga Website Is Best for My Lifestyle?
  • 2.1 Best Yoga Website for Busy People
  • 2.2 Best Yoga Website to Stay Healthy
  • 2.3 Best Yoga Website for Meditation
  • 3. Which Yoga Website is Best on a Budget?
  • 3.1 Best Yoga Website With Free Yoga Classes
  • 3.2 Best Yoga Website With Free Extras
  • 3.3 Best Yoga Website With Subscription Service
  • 4. Overview: The Best Yoga Websites in 2020

Practicing yoga at home means that you can find your center and let go of your worries in the comfort of your own four walls. Not only is that practical, it’s also efficient – online yoga can help you improve your yoga skills and overall health. This article compares 15 yoga websites alongside TINT Yoga in order to determine the best online yoga websites in 2020. To make this possible, the following categories were chosen:

  • Level of yoga (beginner, advanced, aspiring yoga teacher)
  • Lifestyle (busy people, wanting to stay healthy, meditation)
  • Budget (free classes, free extras, best subscription service)

Then, three websites were chosen to compete for each category. Out of these three websites, one website won the overall category. Read on to know which websites were chosen, which website won each category and which website is the best online yoga website in 2020 for your personal yoga goals.

Even if you practice yoga at home, you can still get a group experience, for example in Finlay Wilson’s “The Spirit Within” class on TINT.

1. Which Online Yoga Website Is Best for My Level of Yoga?

This category tells you which online yoga website is the best for your level of yoga. Whether you are a yoga beginner and have been wondering how to learn yoga online, are an advanced yogi or yogini, or if you want to become a yoga teacher – find the perfect yoga lessons online for yourself.

1.1 Best Yoga Website for Beginners

Maybe you’ve heard of yoga before, or maybe you have hit the yoga mat from time to time – but yoga has not yet become a habit for you. These websites help you find the best online yoga for beginners.

Yoga International lets you practice yoga at home with some of the world’s top yoga teachers. New content is added daily, and after enjoying the 14-day free trial, your subscription can be cancelled at any time. If you’re still at the beginning of your yoga journey, Yoga International has a great amount of videos for yoga beginners.

YogaEasy is an online yoga studio with diverse yoga contents. The 7-day trial gives you a first glimpse into the program. Find videos on meditation, a 9-day video series for yoga beginners and yoga videos for elderly people as well as post-natal yoga.

Alo Moves is your at-home studio giving you unlimited access to yoga, fitness and meditation classes for a monthly fee. You can also enjoy a 14-day free trial and cancel your subscription at any time. Alo Moves currently offers over 40 series for beginners, with video series on prenatal yoga, meditation, breathing exercises and yin yoga. You are sure to find something that suits you on their website.

Alo Moves offers you over 40 videos for yoga beginners.

The beginning is never easy. For the first steps of your yoga journey, whether you’ve done yoga before or are completely new to the yoga life, TINT’s choice for the Best Yoga Website for Beginners is Alo Moves, with their over 40 videos for beginners, including yin yoga, breathing exercises and meditation – everything you need for an intense first look into yoga.

The answer to the question “can you learn yoga online?” is thus a resounding – yes!

Did you know that we created a free tool called Sequence Builder that lets you easily create your own sequence by dragging and dropping the asanas you’d like to teach into a beautiful digital design? Check it out!

1.2 Best Yoga Website for Advanced Yogis

You’ve made it a habit to practice yoga, and the yoga life is your passion. The websites in this category are perfect for you, since they will challenge you and help you maintain your level of yoga proficiency through online yoga training.

Alo Moves gives you unlimited access to yoga, fitness and meditation classes for a monthly fee. You can also enjoy a 14-day free trial and cancel your subscription at any time. Alo Moves currently has more than 175 classes for more advanced yogis and yoginis. Another highlight is the section “skills”, which improves your yoga teaching.

Ekhart Yoga was founded by Esther Ekhart, a therapist and experienced practitioner of yoga and meditation. Ekhart Yoga and their 4000 classes of yoga content will help advanced yogis as well as other levels of yogis and yoginis improve their yoga proficiency. The Ekhart Yoga challenges will help you find new heights of yoga!

Ekhart Yoga’s yoga challenges keep advanced yogis on their toes.

TINT Yoga has a mission: Working with the world’s best yoga teachers. That mission will help you find and overcome your boundaries – thus reaching ever-higher dimensions of yoga. Are you ready to surpass yourself? Join us on TINT!

TINT’s mission is to bring you health and happiness – by working with the World’s Greatest Yoga Minds.

The beginning is always difficult, but once you’ve reached a certain level of yoga, maintaining that level can be just as much of a challenge. Our mission at TINT is working with the world’s greatest yoga teachers in order to help you surpass yourself – which is why our choice for the Best Yoga Website for Advanced Yogis is…TINT Yoga!

1.3 Best Yoga Website for Teacher Trainings

Want to become a yoga teacher? Great! This category tells you about the best online yoga teacher training certifications and the best yoga teacher training 2020.

TINT Yoga is an online yoga platform created by Young Ho Kim, a passionate yoga instructor who has been teaching yoga for over two decades. TINT’s mission is to bring health and happiness to you by working with the World’s Greatest Yoga Minds. TINT Academy gives you access to teacher trainings and with the Inside Flow Academy, you can now become a certified Inside Flow Teacher – completely online, from the comfort of your home or wherever you have access to an internet connection. Join us on TINT and find exactly what you are looking for.

And: With our Sequence Builder we give you another tool to support your yoga practice and teaching skills. Would you like to focus on backbends in your next yoga class? Use the filter of the asana groups to give your students a beautiful variety of yoga poses that will focus on backbends. Add transitions to really make the sequence yours.

TINT offers something for everyone – teachers, beginners and advanced yogis. Click to join us today.

Airyoga is a studio located in Switzerland which also has online classes. Airyoga is acknowledged by the Yoga Alliance, having become the number one training possibility for the Yoga Alliance teacher training in Switzerland. The online studio presents you with a number of different yoga classes and teacher trainings. A highlight is the 200-hour advanced training, which supplies you with an intense look into yoga traditions and includes a week-long yoga retreat.

Power Yoga Institute is a Yoga Alliance certified yoga studio located in Hamburg, Germany. Yoga retreats as well as events and workshops on specific topics such as yin yoga and meditation alongside teacher trainings mean that you will definitely find something for your yoga journey. The Power Yoga Institute Online Studio offers a number of classes. A 5-day yoga challenge helps you improve your yoga teaching, while an online yoga retreat helps you escape your everyday life from the comfort of your own home. Another highlight of the Power Yoga Institute is the master school, a 300-hours advanced teacher training that you can build yourself from sets of 25-hour packages. 

The Power Yoga Institute lets you build your own 300-hours advanced teacher training from 25-hour packages.

While there are a number of great online yoga teacher trainings out there, our choice for the Best Yoga Website for Teacher Trainings is the Power Yoga Institute – their master school 300-hours advanced teacher training can be built individually through small, 25-hour packages. That means you can build your yoga teacher training just as flexibly as your body.

2. Which Online Yoga Website Is Best for My Lifestyle?

Yoga is for everyone, and every yogi or yogini has a different life and different needs. That is why this category tells you which yoga website is best for your individual lifestyle – whether you are always busy with life, home or work; want to improve or maintain your health; or want to leave your everyday troubles behind you with meditation and spirituality.

2.1 Best Yoga Website for Busy People

Life gets busy, whether that’s work for you, family life or other obligations. That can make it difficult to think of your physical and mental health. But that’s not a problem, since this category of websites helps you find a moment for yourself every day, or as often as you like, to be alone with yourself and to improve your health. When you do yoga online, you can practice wherever you are.

YogaRaumOnline has more than 300 videos with classes for beginners of yoga and more advanced yogis and yoginis. After a 14-day free trial, which does not result in an automatic membership, you can choose from a number of subscriptions. YogaRaumOnline also offers you a teacher training, which enables you to become an Element yoga teacher. A special highlight is the possibility to do little yoga snippets with a duration of 1 to 5 minutes – that way, you can practice yoga whenever you like and no matter how busy you are.

Yoga Vidya is a website dedicated to spiritual life, providing you with videos on meditation, yoga and ayurveda. With more than 150 videos, you will surely find something that interests you. What makes Yoga Vidya unique is the 4-week intensive teacher training that you can do both offline or online. If you’d like to become a teacher but don’t have a lot of free time, this is the perfect option for you.

TINT Yoga has the right yoga video for you, no matter how much time you have. You can filter videos from up to 10 minutes to over 90 minutes – depending on how busy your day is. Want to take a little more time for yourself? Why not do a 30-day Yoga & Meditation Challenge with TINT’s Matt Giordano? You can also find classes on many different topics, for example Katchie Ananda’s Forward Bends & Hip Openers or Jason Nemer’s One Arm Handstand class. Does that sound good to you? We’re always happy to welcome you into our TINT family.

Or how about one of our workshops, for example Barbra Noh’s Therapeutic Alignment Immersion Workshop?

Barbra Noh’s Therapeutic Alignment Immersion Workshop helps you regain your strength.

Life gets busy, but your health should always come first. That is why TINT’s choice for the Best Yoga Website for Busy People is YogaRaumOnline, with their 1-5 minute yoga snippets! Take a bit of time for yourself, breathe, and feel better in no time.

2.2 Best Yoga Website to Stay Healthy

Is your health not as great as you’d like it to be? Or maybe there are still areas you want to improve? This category gives you an overview of websites that help you, for example if your age restricts you in your movements, or if you’ve just given birth and want to regain your strength.

YogaMeHome‘s vast array of over 700 yoga videos has something of interest for everyone. A special highlight of YogaMeHome is that the team consists of specialists for yoga therapy, meaning that should you practice yoga to soothe your pain, this website is for you.

YogaEasy‘s classes focus on a diverse range of yogis and yoginis. Whether you are a bit older and are experiencing joint troubles, or whether you have just given birth – maintaining your health is easy with the right guidance, which YogaEasy can provide for you.

Ekhart Yoga was founded by Esther Ekhart, a therapist and experienced practitioner of yoga and meditation. Ekhart Yoga provides you with 4000 classes of diverse yoga content. A special highlight are the classes on reducing anxiety through yoga, yin yoga classes (a practice that allows you to let go and relax while sitting or lying down) and a yoga retreat you can do from the comfort of your home. That way, you can improve and maintain your health wherever you are.

Staying fit is important, but not always easy. The right website should help you improve and maintain your health – that is why TINT’s choice for the Best Yoga Website to Stay Healthy is YogaMeHome, with their over 700 yoga videos and their focus on yoga therapy.

2.3 Best Yoga Website for Meditation

Yoga is about physical health, but also about mental health. Helping you find health and happiness is our mission here at TINT – and these websites help you nurture your inner child by meditating and focusing on spirituality.

Gaia is the “largest resource of consciousness expanding videos”. The website focuses mainly on meditation, yoga and spirituality, but also presents you with documentaries on diverse topics. You can try the website for free for 1 week and cancel your subscription at any time.

Yoga Vidya is a website dedicated to spiritual life, providing you with videos on meditation, yoga and ayurveda. With more than 150 videos, you will surely find something that interests you. If you’re an advanced practitioner of meditation, Yoga Vidya may be just the place for you.

Yoga International is a great website for both yoga beginners and advanced yogis. Advanced yogis will profit from the Yoga International yoga challenges. The extensive Yoga International meditation library, which offers guided meditations and breathing exercises, is a special highlight of Yoga International. Let go of everyday troubles by finding your center through meditation.

Yoga International offers you an extensive guided meditation library.

Want to take a moment to breathe and find your center? In our opinion, the Best Yoga Website for Meditation in 2020 is Yoga International with their guided meditation library. Whether meditation is something you’ve never tried before, or an important habit in your everyday life, a little guidance helps you find your inner balance more easily.

3. Which Online Yoga Website Is Best on a Budget?

If you want to practice yoga, but are on a budget – or just want to save a little money for a yoga retreat or a special yoga workshop you’ve been looking at – these websites help you invest in your physical and mental health through yoga.

3.1 Best Yoga Website With Free Yoga Classes

With online yoga, you can belong to a group just as much as before. Try a free class today and find your balance.

Free things are always nice! The following websites offer you free online yoga courses. You can also find free online yoga classes for beginners that help you decide if yoga is for you.

Yogamour supplies you with a small collection of around 50 lovingly chosen yoga videos. All of the videos are completely free. Bärbel, the creator of Yogamour, also offers you a teacher training. What makes this teacher training special is that you can take a handful of modules before deciding if teaching is for you. 

DoYogaWithMe presents you hundreds of high quality yoga classes, yoga challenges, yoga retreats and guided meditations. A Yoga Alliance certified teacher training that is split up into sections online and in person means you will be able to complete your teacher training with extensive advice by the team, while the DoYogaWithMe blog offers you monthly updates on everything new on the website. Sometimes, you can receive a special offer of a 2-month free trial or similar benefits.

Cyberobics offers live classes and workouts. You will find a diverse array of videos, from yoga to dance workouts and weight lifting exercises and targeted exercises for abs, shoulders or legs. Try Cyberobics for free for 14 days. Cyberobics also offers you a number of free workouts.

While still deciding if yoga is for you, taking a free yoga class can help you on your way to yoga. That is why TINT’s choice for the Best Yoga Website with Free Yoga Classes is DoYogaWithMe. Not only do they sometimes offer you a 2-month free trial or other benefits, they also offer you free yoga workouts online – and some workouts that are premium content for subscribers.

3.2 Best Yoga Website With Free Extras

Once you’ve decided upon a website you want to subscribe to, free extras are always nice. These websites present you free extra content with your subscription.

YogaEasy offers you diverse yoga content, including post-natal yoga and yoga for the elderly. The YogaMag is YogaEasy’s yoga magazine, which offers you articles on yoga poses, philosophy and fitness. Whether you want to learn a specific pose, improve your technique or learn how to escape stress by practicing yoga as self-care, the YogaMag offers you interesting articles.

Yoga International lets you practice yoga at home with some of the world’s top yoga teachers. New content is added daily. After a 14-day free trial, you will be able to cancel your subscription at any time. A library with articles on different topics such as philosophy and teaching further expands your yoga knowledge.

TINT‘s Magazine provides you with articles on mindfulness, teaching, yoga & health and specific yoga styles. The video section “Off the Mat”, on the other hand, shows you interview sections and other content centered around yoga. That helps you further expand your theoretical knowledge on all things yoga. TINT also offers you a selection of free e-books, for example this e-book on 10 yoga asanas you may be doing wrong (great for beginners!), or this e-book on yoga class plans that you can use for your teaching. If you’re ready to create your own flows and sequences, then check out our free Sequence Builder. This tool is so easy to use and provides you with lots of inspiration regarding yoga asanas. Become part of TINT to stay up-to-date on everything yoga.

While it’s always nice to enjoy a free yoga class once in a while, other free extras always spruce up a yoga website. For TINT’s choice of the Best Yoga Website with Free Extras, YogaEasy and their YogaMag win. The magazine offers you articles on yoga poses, philosophy and fitness. For even more content on yoga, you’re always welcome to read our TINT magazine.

3.3 Best Yoga Website With Subscription Service

Which subscription service for yoga is for you? Find out which three websites were chosen by our team at TINT.

Alo Moves gives you unlimited access to yoga, fitness and meditation classes for a monthly fee. You can also enjoy a 14-day free trial and cancel your subscription at any time. With 275 series of yoga videos, you will definitely find something that you are looking for. Alo Moves currently offers over 40 video series for yoga beginners and more than 175 videos for more advanced yogis and yoginis. Another highlight are the sections “skills”, which improves your yoga teaching, and “mindfulness”, which offers you methods for meditation and relaxation.

Glo gives you access to over 4000 yoga, meditation and pilates classes. A 15-day free trial ensures that you feel right at home with their program before choosing one of their subscription types. A special highlight is the possibility to work out from home, with little to no equipment, and the diversity of teachers and workout possibilities. Glo wants to personalize your yoga experience to help you feel better in body and mind.

Glo gives you access to over 4000 yoga, meditation and pilates classes.

TINT is a website for everyone, whether teaching, aspiring to become a teacher, a yoga beginner or advanced yoga practitioner – you are always welcome to become part of TINT. Enjoy 14 days free and cancel your subscription anytime.

While all of the online yoga websites on this list deserve their place in the spotlight, and many of the subscription services are great, it’s always great to have a lot of choice for your yoga practice.

That is why TINT’s choice for the Best Yoga Website with Subscription Service is Glo with their 4000 videos on everything yoga, meditation and pilates.

4. Overview: The Best Yoga Websites in 2020

15 yoga websites were chosen for this article – alongside TINT – and every website has something special on offer for you.

Here is a short overview of the winners of every category:

These are the best online yoga websites in 2020, according to us at TINT Yoga.

This article gave you an overview of the best yoga websites in 2020. We hope you enjoyed reading it as much as we enjoyed writing it.

Header Picture by TINT.
